Hi kindlejack!

I don't know if you are allowed to answer this, but: there are nine skins on PBE right now, eight of them are two skin groups of four skins each. It's unusual for that to happen, but the explaination I gave myself is the following: over the last months (years?), you changed the way you make skins. You don't rush your work to have the skins out (we also had a chroma-only patch a few weeks ago, when was the last skin-less patch before that?), but instead if something still needs to be polished, you just set it off (patch cycle being two weeks also helps in this regard, because eve if you do, you don't set the skins off for too long). It seems to me that at least one of these two skin lines was intended to come out earlier, but didn't make it. Is that right?

Note that I support this way of working, I prefer to wait two weeks more and have a skin I'm 100% satisfied with, rather than having more mediocre skins coming out! ^_^

I think it's fine to talk some shop as it's a very real part of my day-to-day. Surprisingly perhaps it's the opposite on skins:

Last year we pushed stuff back (and made, begrudgingly, decisions to cancel some projects) as often as we had to because we didn't have an effective way of tracking production pace as the team grew to almost double it's 2014 size. This year we've still had to cut a couple of things for various reasons but absolutely no content from personalisation has slipped a patch, which is pretty incredible.

Last year we had a pretty intense push to build a world class team with much stronger structure and try our best to make a skin for as may of our champions as possible. We learned a lot, but found that it took a toll on everyone, was impossible to manage and was very hard on other teams trying to co-ordinate with our own. This year by holding ourselves to timelines and goals we were able to work well with our awesome promo team, champion, champ up teams, esports, merch and even live systems (such as the Project Caches).

I hope that your perception is at least in part due to the results of us really striving as a team to make each year better than the last and keep driving the quality bar up for LoL content, despite the challenges we face! As for this skin-heavy PBE cycle part of it is that skins take a while to develop and the launch dates don't always reflect when the work began or the bulk of it was done. You also might see a lull before a big set like Star Guardian because most of the team is hard at work on that - so really we are working hard on something all the time.

One last thing is that we have conversations every day about player value and how we think each skin is shaping up. If there's a skin in the works that isn't meeting our expectations we are very vocal about it. But the forums etc. always remind us that each day we spend polishing any particular skin is a day we're not working on a new skin for a champ that really needs one, and with 132 champs and counting that's a challenge that's not going away any time soon.

Thanks a lot for clarification, I'm surprised but happy to know I was wrong! ^_^

Also, let me give you all a big hug and a big thank you, I think the skins you released over the last year are really a step up, I can see the quality improving with every patch (this is true for other teams too), I think especially 750 skins and chromas are very nice and better than older ones!
Of course there are some misteps from time to time, or skins I just don't like, but the overall level? That definitely increased :)

Do you happen to have data at hand of how many skins have come out over the last few years? I have the impression you are producing a lot more skins than two years ago, but I don't have time to count them to see if I'm right (and if so, how much!) :)

Keep it up! :D

It's past 2am and I need to go to bed, but I know 2014 was ~60 skins and then 2015 was over 100 skins! Not sure how this year will end up but we are in a much better position for 2017. That still means we can't do a skin for every champ every year, but at that cadence it does mean that Viktor, Cass and Zyra are overdue.

Thanks so much for the encouragement I'm going to paste your comment into skins channel :)

So what's the world breaker lore?
Tell us more about the RPG world of those skins.

The general idea was to create a good ol' traditional fantasy theme inspired by Rugged Garen - it's not the flashiest Garen skin but it's got a wonderful '[Fighting Man](https://www.reddit.com/r/lotr/comments/3bqr61/never_realized_that_after_boromirs_death_aragorn/?st=iuhykork&sh=d2bf6e07)' kind of vibe that was just begging for a party of adventurers to join him.

[The first set](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/skin-release/journey-thy-golden-mustache) was imagined as the champions playing a tabletop role-playing game in a cozy non-canon-freljordian tavern; Wizard, Cleric, Knight and Ranger. The names of the skins reflect what the champions chose to call their character, at least [according to their sheet.](https://youtu.be/ZJhFZ2w0Dk8)

The new skins are much the same, except this is a new party embarking on a much darker campaign... and although Braum claims to have learned the game from his mother, any roleplayer worth their salt knows that a game must have a _game master_. I wonder if we'll ever find out who it is.

If you're not familiar with the awesomeness that is [Roleplaying](https://youtu.be/CKtq-bZgS8I?t=1m53s) then I'd recommend watching [Critical Role](http://geekandsundry.com/critical-role-episode-1/), it got enough people in the office excited about D&D that now veterans like myself have no trouble finding recruits for new campaigns! [Acquisitions Inc.](https://youtu.be/LA3VbDqj7C4) are also great at entertainment based rp.

Even never playing dnd etc I love this skin line.  Maybe it's just nice to have a very classic fantasy version of champs. The new world breaker one is great top if you expand on it think about doing a qetzlcoatl ish Aurelion sol!

I'm really happy to hear that both sets are resonating with people! And I totally agree. In a way it was my brother who planted the seed in my head. He'd always play Rugged Garen, which I got for him one Christmas, and I'd ask him why he liked such a simple looking skin. He just said the splash looked like Aragorn and he liked the fantasy style.

Years later when I got to Riot I pitched the idea to the team unsuccessfully in many many meetings. With all the excitement of Sci Fi, DJs, Popstars, Mechas and Magical Girls, my pitch of 'What if we did down to earth classic fantasy skins' sounded a little underwhelming. But through 2015 we tried a lot of 750 thematics, which were very challenging because of the limited scope and really short development times and eventually I found a way to pitch the skin line that really clicked with people. Even then we tried to make sure there was great value in each design - Gragas had never had a serious skin, Varus conversely was always very intense in his other skins, Braum and Ryze had rarely worn shirts :P

I'm glad we got the chance to do a second set. Counting Rugged Garen, Barbarian Sion and perhaps even Greybeard Veigar there's now plenty of adventurers from which to form a balanced party. You could probably even mix in Woad King Darius, Woad Scout Quin and Woad Ashe if you wanted to have deeper ADC picks.
Bard Bard is the greatest one though, it's exactly the skin I wanted him to have since his release.

I'm glad you did it, I like playing that genre fantasy stuff sometimes. And the braum and gragas (and garen) skins have to be my favorites for those champions, although I don't play them tons. I'd add in the orcish mundo and spellthief lux btw

I hope you keep doing this skin line, maybe a druid nidalee would be a bit on the nose but that's one I'd personally like to see
